title: free to play? never in aram!
body:
I while I enjoy playing a champ I don't own in other modes, where it really doesn't matter if you know what you are doing or not, it should NEVER be that you have "free to play" in ARAM.

This is NOT the time or place to learn a new champion, and it is the only mode that matters. Free to play anywhere else, but never in ARAM.

replies.body:
Lol, ARAM is like the least serious mode where people very often don't know what they are doing.

I have every champion. Do you really think I'm good with all or even most of them? You're the only one that seems to expect it.

ARAM is the most serious. What mode could be more serious? It is pure teamfight the entire time with no silliness of "Surprise! I went through the jungle and you are getting ganked! Ha Ha Ha!"

That is stupid. Aram is the only mode that matters.
My apologies. I wasn't sure if you were a troll or not and didn't want to insult you by assuming you were. I won't make that mistake again.

I'm not a troll, I hate ranked, normals and generally anything on rift. There are lots of us. I don't know anyone that hates aram ... though it seems riot is trying real hard to make it so people won't like it.

If you honestly hate Summoner's Rift games, that's fine. You don't have to like the main mode or anything.

The problem is that you're taking what is meant to be and almost unanimously considered as a fun mode far too seriously. If you're going to play a fun mode and take it super serious, don't get upset when everyone else doesn't treat it that way; grab a group of friends that want to tryhard it or just accept that it's actually not a competitive mode.

You're in some serious denial here if you refuse to understand this.

"Fun" and "competitive" aren't mutually exclusive. If you try to win, then it's a competitive mode. It may not be *balanced for competitive*, but it's still competitive. OP's taking things a little too seriously, yet people who completely screw around (e.g. AP Darius or something) aren't taking things seriously enough. Being on either extreme prevents other players from having fun.

lmfao
bots r for fun
if your in pvp and with ANY other goal then winning, your part of reason this community is crap.

League isn't a 15 min CoD game where we can leave 5 mins after seeing you die 7 times and give a chopper to the enemy team, we are here for 45 mins+ and not everyone just sits around on their ass all day to play game after game of "fun" a.k.a an excuse to use for you doing bad, MFrs have jobs and shit
I tend to agree. From a purist point of view, the original aram (on the rift, and a gentleman's agreement) you could re-roll as many times as you wanted to get rid of the free to plays.
Remember when you could use Free to Play in ranked lol. Now that was funny.
Why would anyone care about ranked?
Don't know, but the forums cried on and on til they removed them.
ARAM is strictly fun mode. If you take ARAM seriously, you are in the 1% of the player base.

Hate to tell you this, but there are a lot of people I know and play with that would say the same about ranked. People that play ranked are always saying "that only happens at the lower levels, once you get up into the higher levels the trolls aren't there ...". What that sounds like to people like me is "beat your head against this wall long enough and you won't feel the pain any more." No thanks.

This is a game ... so in that sense, RANKED is strictly fun mode. If you take *any* of this seriously, you are in the same mindset of children that scream when they lose a game. But because it is a game where people can actually spend money, even if they *never* play a ranked game, riot ought to take them as seriously as anyone else.

Once you level up, you are so numb from beating your head against the wall from all the trolls, you forget what it is supposed to be like (a game) and then think it is serious. RANKED: IT IS A GAME. it is no more (or less serious) than any mode. Why? Because it is a game.

Ranked is supposed to be the serious mode where you don't try out new things until you have them down in Normals. That's why people who troll in ranked get banned or suspended. Dominion and Twisted Treeline would be serious modes as well.

Normals is semi-serious. It's where you try to win but you can try out non-meta champs, new strategies, different build paths, etc.

ARAM is just a brawl. It's pure fun mode where you try to get pentas and stuff. Same thing with the rare modes that come out like One For All.

What's the difference between Normals and ARAM? There's still persistent MMR for both modes. I can better understand treating the temporary modes as "pure fun modes," but I don't understand why Normals would somehow be more serious than ARAM. Does being able to practice specific champs in Normals for ranked make it more serious? ARAM lets you practice rounding out your repertoire for ranked. I just don't get it.
You should still try to win in ARAM and Normals, it's just that there is more leeway for trying new things.

ARAM is the perfect place to try new champs. You can actually have fun even if you suck without people raging. In other modes, people have this bizarre belief that the outcome matters (Btw, it doesn't. It's a game. Grow up people.) In ARAM, you can (usually) get a decent group of relatively mature teammates who are actually there to have fun, not get pissy the moment a matchup with completely random players doesn't end perfectly for their team and terribly for the other.

If you think you should only get to play champs you've bought (under some weird assumption that the set of champs you've bought is equivalent to the ones you're good at, which isn't even true for 99% of players) then you've completely missed the meaning of All RANDOM, All Mid. It's about the surprise, not the "do what you do in every single other game all the time." In fact, I'm more interested in the exact opposite idea some people have proposed: make all champions available in ARAM, not just the ones you've bought and f2p.

What you're asking for is basically another game mode. It isn't ARAM and you might as well be asking Rito to remove ARAM.

No, ARAM is much more important than ranked. And it isn't about learning new champions. You learn them in other modes that don't matter. Normals, TT, dominion, ranked, bots. NOT ARAM. it is the most important mode. There are so many people that only play aram. that hate normals and ranked. Nobody hates aram.

I hate ARAM. Sorry, but I like to be able to choose who I'm playing as. Team Builder is my jam. There is nothing wrong with learning new champs in ARAM. If it's okay in other normals, it's okay there.
